Reviews.Title: “Bicycle rental service a +”
Reviews.Author: Cristian_Claudiu
Reviews.Content: The bicycle rental service is definitely a plus. We arrived in Amsterdam by car but the best way to get around Amsterdam is by bicycle, so rent one! You can take the tram for the city center as well, it's very close. Even though I saw on Booking.com that there is a 20â‚¬/day fee for the parking we had it for free, I don't know why, they didn't ask so... :) You won't find free parking in Amsterdam, we searched. The free internet in public areas also a plus, work's great. P.S. Visit the Centrale Bibliotheek (the big library), which is near the Amsterdam Centraal station and Nemo Science center, it is the largest public library in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “NH quality and a decent price”
Reviews.Author: jun8jim
Reviews.Content: Situated just outside the city center, about 25 minutes tram(#9) ride from central station. The tram and bus stop is literally in front of the hotel (Swindenstraatâ€Ž stop). The area is nice and quiet with restaurants, cafe's, grocery store, and a couple bars across the street. An outdoor market and a couple of American fast-food joints are also nearby. Next to hotel is a park/pond on one side and the Tropen museum on the other. From the outside, the hotel looks like a modern design from the early 80's, outdated and unappealing. There is a gate outside and a keycard required for elevators so it seemed secure, even though the neighborhood appeared safe. The lobby is nothing special, but the front desk staff were very friendly, spoke English well, always greeted us, and were helpful when asked questions. They do have SMOKING ROOMS available upon request, and the windows open so it doesn't get too smoky. There is wireless internet access in the rooms but a daily charge of around 10euros required( 30 minutes free in lobby upon request). We actually stayed in two different smoking rooms during our 5 day stay here. Both rooms were quiet, clean, had hairdryer, laptop sized safe, and an instant coffee maker. The first room was smaller, just enough room for two twin beds pushed together and a desk. It wasn't uncomfortable but I wouldn't call it spacious. The shower, closet, and sink was separate from the toilet. There were two problems with this room, first the television didn't work, but more importantly the beds were on wheels which didn't lock in place properly so the bed kept separating. Called front desk, they sent someone to fix within 15 minutes, could not so we switched rooms the following morning. The second room was larger, and the bathroom was "normal". No bathtub but the shower had hot water and good pressure. The beds firm and comfortable. Plenty of closet space. Had a view of the museum which was pleasant to look at. Overall a good room for a fair price. The hotel has a restaurant and bar(didn't use), has a secure baggage storeroom with luggage scale, and restrooms in the lobby. NH hotels are generally known for good service, and Tropen lived up to the reputation. Other than the couple of issues with the first room, the rest of the stay was good. I would probably return here again and recommend it to couples who visit Amsterdam but do not want to be in the middle of the action. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Never had such friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: intense2002uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Tropen over the weekend so we could see amsterdam , even though its not in the centre of amsterdam it was an easy tram ride which was almost like a mini tour in itself. I have travelled all over the world for business and for leisure and i can't remember ever being in such a freinedy hotel, every last memeber of staff was welcoming and each time you passed one they would always say "good morning/afternoon/evening" the little words that dont cost anything but are most often never used. the \continental breakfast was great lots of choice of meats cheese and scrambled eggs bacon and sausages. This was my first stay in a NH hotel and even though i booked through a friend that works for NH i looked at the normal rate and for amsterdam this hotel was excellent value for money allround.

Reviews.Title: “Gem amongst the rough”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a few kips in Amsterdam in the past, but this little beauty had some good prices online and went for it. Very easy to get to by tram from Centraal. It is in a quite area, not much pubs etc going on, but for that get yourself to the main areas. You will have to tram it,but there is a stop really closeby, or a Taxi rank right outside. We got an amazing room, with windows all around, views over the park and city. Very comfy bed, and they offer a pillow menu. Room had lovely wooden floors and great storage facilities. Reception was professional and curteous, we did not try out food etc. Would recommend most certainly for middle of the road hotel in the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and efficient business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: indianguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 4 times and have always enjoyed the efficient check-in and check-out processes and the efficiency. The breakfast which costs a few Euros extra is worth the price. Rooms are clean, have wi-fi access (on payment) and good bathrooms. Overall a pleasant experience every time. I will stay here again. The one drawback is the time it takes to get there from the airport, unless one is taking a taxi one has to take the train from Schiphol to Amsterdam Central and then a tram to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, a bit distant from the centre, terrible Internet access”
Reviews.Author: arturhoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks recently refurbished and the staff is kind, but is a bit distant from the city centre. You do have a tram (9) that stops in front of the hotel and takes you quickly to the inner circle. The hotel provides a very good breakfast (18 euros). The biggest letdown however was the WiFi being charged and with abusive prices (5 euro for half and hour), and the free wifi provided at the lobby is ridiculously capped. In times where any 10 euro hostel, mc donalds of starbucks provides free wifi it is a shame for an hotel to charge you for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not for us”
Reviews.Author: SP MD 2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Tropen in a standard double room. As well the outside as the inside looks old and in need of some updating. The Front Desk staff are very friendly. Check-in and check-out went very smoothly. We had a corner room and as we had an extra person in our group, a rollaway bed was set up. The beds were very comfy. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as the price was pretty high. There are several places within walking distance of the hotel for breakfast, dinner, etc. The room looked clean; however 2 in our group are allergic to dust mite, mold, etc. Both had allergic reactions while in the room. The shower stall had several spots of mold. Because of this, we will not return to the NH Tropen Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby on the outside.........”
Reviews.Author: Duane D
Reviews.Content: But on the inside the hotel was bright, airy and very welcoming. The staff were helpfull and friendlt. Had a great view of the city. the tram stop was right outside the hotel so access to the city was very easy. The hotel is a little way out but walking distance to the Armtis zoo and if you don't mind walking, its a just far enough from the city to walk along the canal to get there

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!!!”
Reviews.Author: GromitNorwich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little way from the centre... but not to worry there is a tram (no. 9) that stops right outside and goes all the way to central station. It is also an easy walk into the city if you are reasonably active. The staff were all very helpful, the rooms were well presented, tidy and kept very clean. We did not use the restaurant in the hotel ( breakfast was 18 euros) instead we purchased slices, cakes etc. from a nearby shop/cafe and went to the nearby Oosterpark and had our coffee and breakfast in there whilst watching people do a tai chi class.....it was wonderful!! There is also a very good restaurant opposite the hotel ( Cafe Museum) which seems to be mostly used by locals, and cooks wonderful food. There are no shortage of places to eat, to enable you to get a flavour of Amsterdam. We would come to this hotel again as it was so friendly. The bike tour we took with Mike's Bikes ( Kerkstraat) was really good, it was three hours of good local history with all the fun of trying out the bikes, which are really easy to ride. It cost 18 euros and was well worth it, and if we were to go again we would definately go back there for our bike hire.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: skeleton-key33
Reviews.Content: Great location, only 10 mins from central Amsterdam, with a tram stop right outside the hotel. The staff were especially great, so helpful and friendly. The beds were very comfortable, we slept well every evening of our 5 night stay, and we'd definately return. Fantastic hotel, great value, well located. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gava100
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, near the zoo and not to far from the central area.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LiaGeorgiadou
Reviews.Content: the breakfast is very good and also you can ask for a smokers room very important especially if you are travelling during the winter. their restaurant is really good i loved having dinner there. clean, good view and friendly enviroment.

Reviews.Title: “NH Tropen does the job”
Reviews.Author: Tony087
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend break staying at the NH Tropen with 11 friends. Great location just outside the city. Easy to get to from Centraal Station by Tram 9 or Bus 22. Taxi's cost between 11 & 20 euro depending on time of day etc. As usual, do not forget to check before hand. All our rooms and beds were a good size. All very clean and tidy. The hotel reception staff were very, very helpful and friendly. They arranged the 2 mini buses back to airport without any fuss. The buses cost 65 euro for 6 people, so saved a lot of time going back into the city. All 12 of us would go back, no problem at all. Behind the hotel is the park, but more importantly.....across the road directly from the hotel was the local high street with a few good bars selling decent beer from smaller breweries etc. We quite liked the Spar90 bar which served Hertrog Jan beer. Just 10 minutes walk from the hotel is the Brouwerij't IJ brewery pub on Funenkade 7. Turn left out of the hotel towards the canal then turn right. Look for the large windmill and the pub is beneath it. Tours at various times are available, but the pub shuts around 2000hrs most nights, so get there earlier. If you are in a group and looking for things to do, try booking the beer bike tour of the city. I will say no more, just search the world wide web thingy. Hope this review helps. Enjoy. Tony

Reviews.Title: “Value for money (for early bookers...) No airco.”
Reviews.Author: johanvcr
Reviews.Content: NH Tropen is part of the NH-hoteles group. NH runs a lot of hotels in Amsterdam and this is one of the cheapest (for early bookers) because it's just outside the city center and located in a not attractive building. NH is mostly good quality so is this hotel. Rooms are well sized, bed is perfect and a very good breakfast. As it is one of the few high-rise buildings in the area you may ask for a upper floor room at the city-center side. Big save private parking for 20 euro a day. This is cheap compared to the 48 euro a day in city center. To the downside: The hotel doesn't have airco which can be annoying on a hot summer day in July or August... Bathroom is a bit outdated (but clean) and the breakfast is expensive (15 euro). No free Wifi (Swisscom, didn't take it but I guess it's around 10 euro/24h)

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up - Value, Location & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: BluePeppers
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at NH Tropen. The rooms were small and bathroom was quite a squeeze but overall the room was very comfortable, clean and nice. We managed to get a room with a view of the museum and it was lovely. The hotel is not very central but tram service is just at the door and main attractions are very easily accessible via public transport which is available 24/7 (bear in mind that public transport is extremely efficient here). It takes about 20 minutes to get to the central area and I would suggest that you get a day ticket or week ticket, depending on your length of stay, as it is more economical and allows you to travel all around Amsterdam. Breakfast at NH Tropen was simple and is nothing lavish but quality of food and drinks were quite good. Although the breakfast service team weren't really bothered about service, the front desk staff were generally polite and friendly. Being further away from the city center, this hotel is in a very peaceful location, ideal for those who are looking for a place to have a good rest and a good nights sleep. You will definitely be away from the hustle and bustle of the Amsterdam night life but still within close reach. Convenience stores are available nearby. Although the bed was comfortable and I slept well generally, there were some downsides to the hotel - I could hear the wind howling when it was windy and at about 5am there was repeated clanking noises (probably from the heating system when it is turned on) which was very annoying. Check-in and check-out was very efficient but wi-fi was only available in the lobby for a limited time which was quite inconvenient. I would highly recommend this hotel for those who are more adventurous and do not mind using public transport to get around. For those who are looking to party and crash, this is not the right hotel as you may have difficulty making your way back after a few drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed it for!”
Reviews.Author: Mumof51411983
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to Amsterdam to see Take That. Wanted a cheap hotel for one night and that is what we got! Arrived at the hotel just after midday bit they let us check in early with we were very pleased about. They asked for a credit card deposit even though we had paid online for our room but when we explained we didn't have a credit card they wavered this despite us offering cash. Room was good and a nice size. Bed was on wheels on a wood floor which was a bot annoying but by the time we got back in the early hours I didn't care although my other half complained about the pillows being small. Plenty of storage space and a digital safe which was handy, Bathroom and toilet were separate and clean with plenty of towels. When we came in a stupid o'clock in the morning the man on reception was very friendly and super helpful. I was very impressed with the service!! The hotel was a bit out of the way but public transport in Amsterdam is brilliant as are all the public transport staff..... 200% better than in London! Number 9 tram passes through every 5-10 minutes and takes you through the centre to the station and runs until 12.30am when you can hop on the number 357 nightbus. On the whole it does what it says and I would say give it a g!!

Reviews.Title: “Great business type hotel for leisure too....”
Reviews.Author: Evaking1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel last winter when the snow attacked Amsterdam. Still the hotel was a warm and calling place. They time after time have good promotions so the price of the room was really good. It is not far from the city center, absolutely not far.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: bizzykrizzy
Reviews.Content: Not much from the outside but lovely inside. Very friendly and competent reception. Room reasonably spacious, adequate for two people. We had two twin beds which could be moved 2 inches apart. The mattresses were very comfortable and I slept well for 4 nights. Tea and coffee making facilities. Modern safe in the room. Wardrobe space a little on the small side for two people. Lovely view over the adjoining park and quiet on the 8th floor even with the windows open. We didn't hear the guests in the next room either. Bright and airy, the windows could be opened (leading out to a tiny balcony). The toilet is in a separate room (plus a wash basin) from the rest of the bathroom which was great. But that meant the bathroom itself (wash basin and shower) was very small. Not much space to put your toiletries, hang your towels etc. Plenty of hot water though day and night and water pressure was good even on the 8th floor. Bathroom was equipped with a hair dryer. Room was cleaned every day but the maid often forgot to do something or other like replace towels, tissues, note paper or coffee sachets, clean the cups etc. We tried the breakfast buffet one morning which offered a great range of food, all very tasty and fresh, but slightly overpriced at 18â‚¬ (15 if booked in advance). As everyone else has written, the hotel is not in the centre but there's an abundance of public transport nearby. Tram no. 9 and bus 22 stop right outside. They come frequently and the ride on the 9 to the centre of town (called "Dam") is about 13 min. Tram no. 3 also stops not far from the hotel and goes directly to the Van Gough museum. The hotel can sell you museum tickets for 75 cent surcharge which saves a hugely long wait in line - definitely worth getting. Next door to the hotel is the Tropen museum and the zoo ("artis") is also not far. (Next to the zoo is Cafe Koosje that does nice inexpensive breakfast. The cafe "Coffee To Walk" opposite the zoo also does breakfast.) There are a few nice restaurants nearby (I particularly liked the food at "Spar 90" in the same street as the hotel) as well as a supermarket - very convenient. Beware that the hotel charges â‚¬20 a day for parking your car in their car park which I thought was rather steep. But they do free wifi in the lobby. Overall the 3 star rating is very fair and the Tropen is on the upper end of that.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware! They take money from your credit card without letting you know!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth_Masters
Reviews.Content: As holding a university degree at hotel management, I'll share both - my professional evaluation and my emotions as a tourist. Upon the arrival the reception took our credit card (which is OK), saying that they need only the information and later in the evening we discovered that 350 Eur were taken from the credit card even without letting us know. We had our stay+breakfast+all taxes prepaid well in advance by the travel agency as it was also acknowledged by the reception's staff. YOU DO NOT TAKE MONEY FROM ANY CREDIT CARD WITHOUT LETTING KNOW THE FACT AND THE SUM TO THE HOLDER OF THE CARD!!! It was hard not to overhear in the lobby the same situation with some other guests as they apparently traveled with limited resources and were suddenly left with no money on their account, so they made emergency calls back home to try to borrow some money. We got our money eventually back only a week after we left. The room was very dusty (housekeeping does only floors) and once we even ended up with 7 dirty coffee mugs after the housekeeping. It seems that they give new towels, but never take the used ones away, so we had constant piles of towels. Besides, they were all sticky from the improperly rinsed detergent. Breakfast was ok, however, it's unprofessional for the staff to shout to each other all the way across the restaurant. The free lobby internet is extremely slow. In conclusion: This hotel is NOT suitable for people with: 1. Dust allergies 2. Detergent allergies 3. Claustrophobia (only elevator, no stairs) 4. Limited money resources If you stay there, check your bank account, so you don't have unpleasant surprices! To NH chain: Please, do invest money in proper staff training, there are too many things your staff does wrong because of lack of training!

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay in a pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH Tropen for 4 nights while paying my first visit to Amsterdam. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and spoke excellent English. My room was a good size, and well appointed - even though it was on the 9th floor, there was never any problem hanging around for an elevator. The bed was comfortable, and there was no shortage of hot water for the shower etc. Breakfast was also good (buffet style), with a wide variety of cereals, breads, meats, cheeses, fruits, and hot sausages/bacon/eggs. The hotel is located a little way from the centre of Amsterdam (15 min walk) but the frequency of reasonably-priced public transport just outside (trams and busses) ensures that the location isn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Taken for a ride”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinCoCorkEire
Reviews.Content: My son and i spent 3 nights at this hotel in November of this year. When checking in we were asked for 150euro deposit, from credit card. I had a laser card and entered my pin no for 150euro. The girl i was dealing with said "This is'nt a credit card' so i offered cash and paid another 150 euro which i got receipt for. That was fine. we enjoyed our stay and our visit to Amsterdam very much. We checked out on monday , i gave my receipt for cash and got back 146 euro cash, minus price of one pint of beer. Well when i arrived home i discovered they also had taken 150 euro out of my bank account, ie the laser card worked, so now they still owe me 150 euro and have had sereral telephone conversations with manageres She keeps asking for receipt which i had to give her to get my cash back. Still waiting for 150 euro which was taken out of my bank account and will not give up until i receive same + cost of lots of telephone calls. Caitlin Lynch Co Cork Eire . Please give back what ypu owe me.

Reviews.Title: “Decent European Hotel but too far away.”
Reviews.Author: struct84
Reviews.Content: From the Central Station in Amsterdam it cost $25 Euros to get to the NH Tropen in Amsterdam. If you look at a map of Amsterdam the hotel is right next to the Tropen Museum. However, it's a 15-20 minute tram ride to get to the City Center. This was too far from the center of Amsterdam activity to me and most tourists I think. I purchased my room from another website rather than directly through NH Hotels website. Several amenities were listed that just didn't exist. There was no breakfast included...even though I paid $168 a night. Breakfast was an additional 18 Euros. I was told because of booking through another website that I was not entitled to breakfast even if I had paid more than many guests who booked directly though the hotel's website. There was also no free newspaper because of this as well. Internet was an additional 10.70 Euros for 24 hours. All of the stores and restaurants in the hotel area close very early - by 6-8pm so if you stay here make sure you eat while you are in the City Center or get food to bring back to the hotel. The hotel restaurant is only open for breakfast and 3 hours during the evening. It was also listed that this hotel had Tempurapedic Foam mattresses. This is untrue. The mattresses were so hard that it was impossible to sleep on your back. With as much walking around as Amsterdam requires it is nice to come back to a comfortable bed. Honestly I think a thin mattress in a cheap Hostel would be much more comfortable. The room itself was modernly appointed, however the toilet is literally in a former closet, and the sink in the toilet closet is smaller than an airplane bathroom sink. The shower and another sink are in another room. There is also a closet in the shower room that also contains a safe that will fit most laptop computers and other valuables. The housekeeping is apparently paid by how many rooms they do. I put out the 'do not disturb' sign to avoid servicing of my room. I was gone several hours and when I returned the sign was turned around to the other side, saying "Please clean my room". The housekeeping lady rushed to my room and told me to please put the "do not disturb" sign inside my door, or she would not get paid for cleaning that room, even though she didn't clean my room. The next day I didn't put out the sign and when I returned, there was a half used bar of soap dropped on the floor and left there, and apparently the housekeeper had decided to use my toilet and there was a large wad of toilet paper in the toilet waiting to be flushed. I think most travelers would be do much better to either find a hotel in the center of the City or wait until arrival and find a room. Even though I was here during a very busy time, there were still rooms available everywhere for much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rachel291
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business mid-November. The staff were friendly and helpful and went out of their way to advise on public transport routes and walking distances. Located next to the Tropen museum, it doesn't look great on the outside, but inside its very nice. It was spotlessly clean, the rooms were modern and I had a room with a huge window with the view of the park and across the city. There were tea and coffee making facilities and lots of storage space. Wifi is free in the lobby or at cost in the room. The bar had a nice atmosphere. The location was good; it is about a 15-20 minute walk to the central station but buses and trams stop right outside if you don't fancy the walk. I wouldn't bother with the breakfast at E18 as there are a number of cafes and bakeries within a couple of minutes walk. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thats_10
Reviews.Content: Was there for several days, part of it for business and part of it for a weekend with wife. The hotel is very nice, very clean, very good breakfast. stuff do try to serve you, giving you good feeling. view from the room was excellent, Tropen museum. Behind hotel there's a beautiful park with ducks and stuff. Tram 9 has a bus station directly in front the hotel. with tram 9 you can get to the center of amsterdam or to the main station.Near hotel there's a very good greek restaurant . ask in hotel. Defects: During my stay I was in two rooms. one with seperate bathroom/toilet, The bathroom was very inconvenient narrow. The second room was with one bathroom/toilet room . The shower wall was too close to the sink. Although I'm not thin at all , I could have managed, Yet, for some of you it could be inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “We paid â‚¬150 but had a nice park facing...”
Reviews.Author: Sim0nmc
Reviews.Content: We paid â‚¬150 but had a nice park facing room. This is perhaps 2-3km from city but a lovely area near the zoo. Staff were friendly and we just stayed around the area as there were nice restaurants 200metres away. We will go again.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: suemoo35
Reviews.Content: lovely place to stay ,rooms just what you need for a great wekend,easy to get the tram but me and my husband walk everywhere .would go back there is a nice place to eat across the road

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Nat-2025
Reviews.Content: NH Tropen was perfect for our 3 day stay in Amsterdam. Rooms were comfortable & always kept clean. Breakfast was included when we booked & it was very good, lots of choice. Didn't have much interaction with the staff during our stay but those we seen were pleasent enough. The hotel is not situated in the main city centre but is right next to the lovely Oosterpark (It was snowing during our stay & the park looked just stunning.) Dam Sq is easily accessible by the number 9 tram which stops right outside the hotel & takes under 10 minutes. Although we didn't spend much time in the hotel, it was a fantastic place to come back to after a busy day exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Tropen Museum and Park”
Reviews.Author: gravediggersdaughter
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not located in the absolute center of Amsterdam, it is very well situated near a beautiful park. Parking is available. The building itself is not beautiful, but it is clean and functional. The breakfast room is nice, and there is a great selection. Across the street from the hotel is a tram line, and so getting into the city is no problem. Not a five star hotel, but a good three-star, with all the services you need. The personnel are very helpful, and the guests are varied: business-oriented, tourists, students, etc. All in all, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Above average 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dev1ous_One
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May sharing a twin room with a friend. Our room was located on the top floor so we had an excellent view of suburbs. Rooms are quiet, fairly large, very clean, and have comfortable beds. Bathroom and toilet are in separate rooms which is always a bonus! (Slighty strange though was the location of wardrobe in the bathroom?) The location of the hotel was the only real downside being that it was a good 15-20mins walk / 5mins tram ride to the city centre, but that didn't bother us too much. We didn't pay for 'breakfast included' or eat at the hotel restuarant so can't comment on its quality. Overall very good value for money if you are prepared to put up with a short walk into town. N.B. Beware -> Paid up front for this hotel through lastminute.com which apparently included 'all taxes' but upon check-out we were charged an extra 3.16euros per night 'City Tax'. At this time of writing I am still waiting for a response from lastminute.com regarding this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and quiet- good parking.”
Reviews.Author: williamBonn
Reviews.Content: We came here for a weekend to explore the city with the children and enjoyed our stay very much. Parking was included - a huge problem otherwise in Amsterdam. Personnel was v friendly, rooms were large and spotless, breakfast was excellent with a huge choice. (the children particularly enjoyed the chocolate flakes on toast!) Would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place overall”
Reviews.Author: spbeam
Reviews.Content: I was here with a GoAhead tour group - and this was the first leg of our Benelux trip. Loved the room, the bathroom, albeit small, had great amenities - bedroom was great and comfortable. Breakfast was top notch - the best out of all the hotels we stayed at on the trip. We took a bus to most places, and one of their streetcars back, so it was not a problem. Can be foggy in Amsterdam in the mornings, which is kind of cool.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect for a relaxing stay in AMS”
Reviews.Author: PsychLou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really easy to find. Hop on the number 9 tram from Central Station and get off at the stop after Alexanderplein, the hotel is right across the street. The trip takes about 15 mins or so. The reception staff are lovely and make you feel very welcome. The hotel is nice and clean. The room wasn't huge, but there was plenty of storage space for clothes and space to put your bags out of the way. The cleaning staff looked after us every day after 12 as we put on the do not disturb sign - it's nice to be able to have a lie in on your holidays! Similarly, having a hotel that's not right in the heart of the action meant peace and quiet at night. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel so I can't comment on the quality. The hotel rents bikes but I think the supply is limited as we missed out - I can't recommend hiring bikes while in Amsterdam highly enough. The hotel is not too far from the centre so you can zip in quickly and I found it so much more convenient to bike across the city when going between attractions than try to use public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Definitly value for money!”
Reviews.Author: jessicarrr1
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed for 3 nights as a birthday get-away. We were really pleased with it. The rooms are as shown on the website, very modern with hairdryer and vanity mirror in the bathroom, and a tv with many english speaking channels for no extra cost. There is also a safe, with pin code entry. The staf were extremely helpful and polite, and gave recomendations on where to go and what taxi firm was the cheapest. Rooms were cleaned daily by maids, and the continental breakfast catered for everyone. Hotel bar was reasonably priced (cheaper than most bars in the hown center). There is a tram stop directly outside the hotel with trams 9 and 14 going into the city center, its worth getting a tram pass from tourist information at the train station, trams came every 8 minutes or so, so not much standing around waiting. Opposite the hotel is a small highstreet, with clothes shops, supermarket and on saturdays a very large market. The hotel is out of the city centre, so you can sleep peacefully and comfortably, and is near enough for a ten minute tram ride.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Reliable”
Reviews.Author: tribepride
Reviews.Content: This is now my go-to property for business travel in Amsterdam - I've stayed 3x in 2009 and once now in 2010. Friendly and competent staff, comfortable rooms, nice breakfast, adjacent to running/walking trails through OosterPark and the Tropics Museum, tram stop just in front of hotel, and within easy walking distance to Muiderpoort train station. Near enough to the action in Amsterdam, but in a nice quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: zuzini
Reviews.Content: We got at the hotel with a shuttle bus fron the airport that was rather expensive. The hotel is nice, clean and quiet, right next to the Troppen Museum. In front of the hotel is the tram (nr 9) station that takes u in the city center (Dam Square). The breakfast is very good: 2 types of cheese, 3 of ham, eggs, sausages, fresh jus, milk, coffe, the and cookies. All that you need. The room is not very big, but is enough for two persons. The staff was not so friendly, but they spoke very good english. The parking was very expensive 20euros /day

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: glnorton
Reviews.Content: it was far better than we expected. Great room, great breakfast, tram right outside. Staff very helpful next to a beautiful part lovely for walking we are senior citizens and it was perfect for us

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, more like a 4* in my opinion!”
Reviews.Author: iana_bucharest
Reviews.Content: nice decorated rooms, just like the ones they have in their official site. good location, tram just outside the hotel, both 9 and 14 take u directly in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quiet Place in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ashish_Tripathi
Reviews.Content: The NH Tropen offers a nice quiet place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. The service was very good and they offer bikes for rental. It is close to the Heineken Experience and our room offered a great view. The only drawback would be that there is no air conditioning which might be bad in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth the money”
Reviews.Author: stefan_osterdahl
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel that doesn't cost so much more than a hostel and it only costs <10 euro to get to centrum with a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel away from the action, located in a multicultural area”
Reviews.Author: keeshuh
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel which is situated right behind a large city park. There are trams going to the city centre which stop directly infront of it. Staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: italytravelers
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to think after reading the other reivews - knew we had a 50/50 chance of a decent hotel. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. We were on the 8th floor, check in was quick, the staff were pleasant and our room was clean with modern decor. The hotel is next to the Tropen Museum and a park. There is also a street market nearby. The street tram stop is in front of the hotel and it takes about 20 minutes to walk to the city center. I would stay here again. The bed was comfortable and they have a pillow program where you can select from an assortment of pillows (down, neck pillow, etc.) for premium sleep. I love the fact that there is no carpet in the room - dark laminate floors, which I find more sanitary. There is a great selection of TV stations for different languages if one is stuck in the room. We had a view over the park and it was very quiet. I doubt that this hotel has air conditioning, but it was in the 60s in June, so they didn't need it when we were there. We did have breakfast which had a selection of warm and cold items that included boiled and scrambled eggs, breads, deli meat, cheese, fruit, cereal, pastries, coffee, juice, etc.. Impressed overall. Since we were with a conference, we had a special rate with breakfast. If you choose to eat breakfast there, try to get the price in writing because we were quoted 3 different prices when asking 3 different people - one said 15, another 18 and we ended up paying 19 Euros- this last aspect is actually a strong negative. Also note that the higher up you stay, the more you pay - they don't tell you this when they assign you a room (we did not request the 8th floor), but again we had a special conference rate. I would stay here again and I would go without the breakfast - a roll at a bakery for 1 Euro is good enough for me. Very comfortable, quiet with great service. Also, I heard that you can request from the front desk access to the computer/internet in the lobby for 15 min free per day. I did read that wireless for 24 hours costs 22 Euros. And if you would like to check out at 2pm rather than 12pm, the charge is 30 Euros I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for a 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: CanadianFunGuy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite nice with an ultra modern flair. The cleaning staff would not pass the white glove test but the front desk staff are very helpful. The breakfast is overpriced if not part of the room package. The Museum cafe restaurant across the street is unexpectedly good. The internet is a bit pricey but it appears to be on par for The Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “12 hour service means it”
Reviews.Author: Seat62A
Reviews.Content: Arrived before 10pm to be told the kitchen was closed and therefore no food until the morning. Rooms are okay. bed reasonable. WiFi at 22euros is expensive for 24 hours and requires a credit card. Hotel architecture appears to think that East Germany represents a design classic internally it feels like a 1970s public building. Wouldn't recommend it as a hotel for a business traveller its more of a room in the city than a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent reasonable price hotel”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenjohn
Reviews.Content: On the 9 and 14 tram lines - going through the centre to Central Station. Situated in the park and next to the museum - quiet and peaceful but 15 mins by tram from the action. Rooms small but good. Don't bother eating - prices are far too high. Opposite is a street with cafes and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance but the staff were keen to help...”
Reviews.Author: RobDan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a good balance between central location and price. At check-in the staff were very friendly and effecient and we were in our room within 5 minutes of arrival. Although the parking spaces available are very limited we had no trouble getting a space, even arriving around 7pm on a Fri night. Unfortunately we were then told that the hotel restaurant is closed Fri, Sat and Sun nights, something that is not mentioned on their website. After managing to find a local restaurant which wasn't fully booked we returned to the hotel for a drink at the bar, only to be charged almost â‚¬15 for 2 drinks, no wonder it was empty... We booked a "superior" room with tea and coffee facilities for an extra â‚¬15 per night. The toilet and shower were in seperate cubicals, both of which are just a bit too small. The toilet had no ventilation and the shower area is too small to even dry yourself off. We could not find anything superior about the room when compared to many other hotel chain standard rooms. Unfortunately over the 3 nights of our stay the room wasn't once cleaned properly, it appeared the maid simply straightened the bedding and emptied the bins. The reception staff were very helpful when we reported this and discounted out parking charges as compensation. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, the price of â‚¬18 per person is quite frankly ridiculous. We stayed in the Hilton in Berlin last year and paid far less. There are any number of cafes close by which offer much better value for money. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel due it's location, but we would look to stay elsewhere if we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great”
Reviews.Author: jirrupin
Reviews.Content: The NH Tropen is a great hotel, at a reasonable price, in a nice quiet location in Amsterdam. Our check-in was smooth (despite the fact we arrived mid morning), and our room extremely clean, modern and comfortable, with a beautiful view over the Oosterpark. The hotel is only a 10minute tram ride to the Dam. We felt that being a little bit out of the centre was worth it for the comfort of the hotel, which was very good. We didnâ€™t have breakfast at the hotel so canâ€™t comment on that, but free tea and coffee is provided in the room. The hotel is also very funky in its style, with lots of little jokes on everything from the doors of the lifts to the drink coasters. Not overdone â€“ just cool. They also had an amazing art installing on the front of the hotel while we were there of multicoloured clothes. Iâ€™ve posted a photo. Check out at this hotel is not until noon which is great. The TV in the room did not just have the normal BBC World, Sky News channel, but also interesting channels like Comedy Central. This is a great place to stay in Amsterdam. If you donâ€™t mind sacrificing a little centrality for good comfort (but still staying very close to the centre), then I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: oupsss
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed for 5 nights at the nh tropen hotel and i have to admit it was better than i expected. its a very clean hotel and the stuff is the most helpful i have ever met. they all speak english fluently and they are doing their best to help you. the room were spacious enough but what was really noticeable was that the wardrope was in the bathroom!!! funny ha? the view is fine, i stayed on the 2nd floor where there are only windows (big ones) and no balcony, but that was no problem to us. brekfast was adequate, bread tost croissant cheese salami sweets eggs bacon honey etc. the location is ideal for rest and walks to the nearby big park. but if you are looking for pubs or restaurants..sorry you re gonna have to go to the city center (short distance by the tram). there are some places to eat or have a beer,just across the hotel, but i would reccomend them on a rainny day- night where the choices are limited. all in all, its a nice hotel to choose, because the tram is convenient and if you like walking you can reach the city centre in 30 minutes apoximately. quiet, clean, friendly stuff! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “excellent .”
Reviews.Author: mclws3
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel,clean and very modern,friendly staff and well located for trams,only downside was very expensive bar prices ie 9.50 euros for a wine and a beer.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jfallesen
Reviews.Content: I thought I knew that all NH Hotels were actually very nice and comfortable hotels, so when I booked NH Tropen, I thought it was going to be excellent â€“ and the home page did very little to change that (not surprisingly). However, I was quite disappointed when I arrived. The reception staff was friendly enough and check-in was easy. It did occur to me, that it did not look rather worn when entering, and this was only to be confirmed. The room was quite small (and judging from the emergency exit chart on the door, they all were on my floor), and it was rather gloomy due to the heavy use of brown colours and not much lighting. It was also very cold, and it took me some time to find out that there was a hole underneight the TV set where I could reach into a thermostat and turn on some heating. A colleague staying in another room also met a very cold room. The heating was effecient but such a cold room is just not very welcoming. My room had twin beds which were not large but rather comfortable. Unlike most other hotel chains, NH actually offers a "pillow menu", giving you a choice of a number of different types of pillows. That is a nice feature, but even the standard ones were fine. The room had seperate WC and bathrooms, both very small. As a male, you would almost have to make up your mind on your use of the WC before entering to ensure that you entered the room the right way round. There did not appear to be any heating in the WC, so there was no hanging around there reading the newspaper. Bathroom was also rather small with a tiny shower niche. Not much water pressure in the shower, and the fittings were generally rather worn, but otherwise it was OK. Apart from all the regular items found in hotel bathrooms, they also had extras like a sponge, dental kit, and a comb. For regular visitors they even offered to keep your gels and liquids (like shaving gel) so that you would not have to worry about that at the airport if you were a hand baggage only traveller. That is actually quite a good idea, if you have the need. One rather weird thing was that the cupboard was located inside the bathroom. The TV set offered a selection of Dutch TV channels plus a few international ones, including BBC 1 & 2, but not a major news channel like BBC World, Sky News, or CNN. But in fact, rather than watching TV, you might simply want to enjoy the view. I was on the 9th floor, and the view from there was fantastic. Surprisingly, even on the 9th floor there was quite a lot of traffic noise from down below. Some of this noise would come from the trams, with tram line 9 operating just outside the hotel, taking you straight into the centre of Amsterdam, including to the central station and Rembrandtplein. Connexion shuttle buses are operated to and from the airport, so if you are travelling by public transport, the place is conveniently located. Parking is available, though at an extra price, and they only have a few spaces. Finally, I would say that I was quite disappointed that everything was extra and at a high cost. With rather limited parking, a charge for this is fair enough, but â‚¬17 for an incredibly dull breakfast is a rip-off. Instead of having your breakfast at the hotel, find a cafe or similar somewhere else â€“ it is likely to be both cheaper and better. Internet access was also an extra, offered by Swisscom at a rate of â‚¬10 for one our or â‚¬17 for 24 hours. With many other hotels offering this service for free, this is really appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Edinburghjimmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in late September 2007 and were very pleased with the accommodation although the bedroom was not very large. The beds were very comfortable and there was a wide choice of pillows available. The buffet breakfast was more than adequate and was available until 10 am and later at weekends. Our only slight criticism was that the room maid twice forgot to replace the tea and coffee although the reception desk did so very willingly. The staff are exceedingly polite and helpful, as indeed are almost all the people we encountered in Amsterdam. The location is nice and peaceful, right next to the Oosterpark which has some interesting modern sculptures and a large lake full of ducks and swans. It is also very near the Sloten Windmill which is about the only one to see in Amsterdam. There are good tram connections all round the Oosterpark enabling you to get to the museum quarter, Leidseplein and Rokin within ten minutes and a very fast bus connection to the Centraal Station which gets you there in just under ten minutes. Finally, the street opposite the hotel has many cafes and restaurants so you can have Greek, Indonesian, Chinese or Dutch food all at very reasonable prices locally.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nandv
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in NH Tropen for 4 nights. Would recommend this hotel as a good-value and convenient place to stay in Amsterdam. Hotel is right on the No. 9 Tram direct to Central Station via Dam Square. Also very close to No 10 to Leidesplein and the musuem area and No.14 to near the Anne Frank House. Room was perfectly fine with a good bed, nice toiletries, etc. Hotel is situated in a pleasant area, not right in the centre of things or on the prettiest canal, but since all these are very near by tram, thats no problem. Amsterdam is a compact city so it's very easy to get around by the excellent public transport - suggest buying the 24, 36, 72 or 96-hour transport ticket (only â‚¬16.50 for 4 days unlimited tram, bus, night bus and metro services!). Staff were pleasant and helpful. Didn't sample the breakfast which at â‚¬17 sounds a bit pricey but with a room only rate of â‚¬90 you should go out and eat in one of the excellent Amsterdam cafes - don't miss the 1st Klas Cafe in Central Station (Platform 2b) if you have time.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: lambros_21
Reviews.Content: I was there during the end of may for five days with my wife. It is in an excellent location next to the oster park and the tram is just across the street. It is only twelve minutes from downtown and since it is not exactly in the city centre it is quiet. The room was neat and clean,(on the eighth floor with a fine view of the city centre), the breakfast buffet was very good and most of all we got a better price for the room compared to other hotels in the center of Amsterdam. I would recommend it to anybody that is looking for a hotel were he can sleep well, eat his breakfast and wants to be anywhere in Amsterdam within 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Everything fine until they kicked us out...”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett745
Reviews.Content: 24 hours after we learned that our daughter was in the ICU my husband and I were en route to Amsterdam. Her husband was flying in from Tokyo. We didn't have time to book a hotel before traveling to the Netherlands. After checking on our daughter's status, we walked in to the NH-Tropen Hotel which was close to the hospital. We were told we could have two rooms (one for my husband and me and one for my son-in-law), for 4 nights, June 10, 11, 12, 13. We said we would take them. Twice we asked about extending the stay but were told that they might only be able to give us one room. We should check in the morning to be sure. It didn't sound like they were going to have room so we made other arrangements for the nights of the 14th and 15th. When we returned to the hotel the night of the 13th we were told that we were supposed to have checked out that morning. What was our reservation verification number? We explained that we had walked in on Sunday and didn't have an advance reservation. At 11pm we were handed our bags which had been packed by the hotel staff. The young woman at the desk was obviously annoyed that "her manager" had placed her in such a difficult position but she never offered to help us find another hotel. Fortunately, we were able to contact the hotel we had planned to move to the next day. They took us in. The taxi driver said we were the second people who had been kicked out of the hotel that day. Obviously the hotel was over-booked. What a shabby way to treat clients. They also charged us more for the rooms than we had been told when we checked in. Unfortunately, we didn't have anything in writing to show them what we had been told. Next time we'll know!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & peaceful stay, excellent neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Peponaki
Reviews.Content: Very nice & peaceful stay, excellent neighborhood! The hotel is situated about 10 minutes by tram or bus away from the city center, just near Oestrerpark and Tropen Museum, however the stop is outside the hotel and the trams or buses pass very often, so we could easily access the center and go wherever we wanted. The neighborhood is very nice and calm (thankfully!). Our room was on the 7th floor, with an excellent view to the park nearby, a bit small but comfortable and clean. We woke up every morning listening to the birds singing! Amazing! The staff was very friendly, the breakfast was more than enough (included to the price of the room), the hotel was simple but nicely decorated... We enjoyed our stay there, and on our next visit to Amsterdam we shall absolutely book again!

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra for Superior”
Reviews.Author: charliec6061
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed in this hotel in Jan 06. We chose it as it was very reasonably priced compared to most directly in the centre, and the pictures of the superior rooms looked great. It is abit out of the centre, but a No 9 tram stops right outside, it would take you about 45mins to walk to the station, but the tram stops past 12pm at night, which is handy! We were not diapointed with the rooms, the were very stylish, kind of Japanese, red fabric, dark wood & black, with a HUGE bed!! The only annoying thing is the shower & toilet are in 2 little seperate rooms & the rooms are non smoking, but it is very easy to open the window & lean out!! Some of the rooms have a lovely view over the park as well. We did not have breakfast, but found a lovely American/Dutch style cafe in Waterloopen, that dishes up a mean pancake & freshly squeezed orange juice. Overall I would reccommend this hotel if you want something that is reasonably priced, but still looks & feels expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, quiet”
Reviews.Author: sea-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, friendly staff, 7 min by bus or tram from Dam - very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “OK, not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: milepig
Reviews.Content: First things first. I was working for a company who made all the hotel arrangements, so I have no idea what the room cost or even what level room I had, but I think I was in a standard room which was on the 7th floor. This hotel was a very mixed bag for me. They get the big things right, but the small things are terribly wrong. The hotel is located a bit off the street and can be a bit hard to find the first time, but it is directly behind the tram stop on the right side of the street if you're leaving the city center. After entering the hotel property through a very strange gate in a fence with barbed wire on top you enter into a very calming courtyard and then into the lobby which is fairly attractively decorated in a modern fashion. The bar/restaurant is at the back overlooking Oosterpark, the breakfast room to one side (also with windows on the park) and the front desk is located right across for the lifts, allowing the staff to keep an eye on things. Security was OK (despite the strange balcony mentioned in previous reviews) and you need your room key to get into the lifts. Checkin was very easy as I was all prebooked and they just handed me my keycard. I don't know what other experiences would be. The room was indeed small, but fairly nicely laid out with an adequate bed that was very firm, two side tables, a desk with chair, one additional side chair, and a nice wardrobe. The bath was small and with only a shower, but was adequate. One problem was that the towels were not replenished in any regular fashion and the number and size of towels varied from day to day. The ammenties were never replenished and the very small glycerine soaps melted away in about a minute. Other problems. My wakeup call never came, although by that time I had discovered that the TV had an easy to use alarm which sufficed. I reported that my door was broken and that I had to slam it to get it closed. It was never repaired, despite a promise to do so. The elevator lobby on my floor had two ceramic vases on a table, one of which was broken. Other minor problems were also present, but nothing extraordinary. They just all combined to give me the impression of a hotel that wasn't trying very hard. Breakfast was OK, but I wasn't paying as it was included with my room. The usual coffee, meats, cheeses, cereal, fruit, etc. but also cooked eggs sausage and bacon. I was worried about the location, but it was actually fine. The number 9 tram does stop right outside and runs frequently throughout the daytime but stops at about midnight. I actually walked into the city center several times, a very safe 30 minute walk, and easy to do. I actually walked back at 2:00 am one morning and I had no problems whatsoever as there were several other people out on the street as well. The area is a bit sketchy but OK. There is a weekend street market down the street and a few shops that aren't terribly interesting. Several restaurants and bars are close by and there is also a coffee shop if that sort of thing interests you. The park is nice for a morning walk or run but does get odd at night. If you stray too far you will very possibly find yourself in an immigrant area which seemed safe but not the normal Amsterdam. All in all, a decent stay but there are certainly better choices closer to the middle of town. It would be fairly easy to get to if you are driving, since it is located right on a main road that connects directly to the ring road and you don't need to drive anywhere near the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Terrazul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NH Tropen for four nights in June. Overall it's a very nice hotel, comfortable room ( stayed in the 8th floor with a nice city and Tropen Museum view ) and great beds. The only problem was that we caught some days with 28, 29 degrees and the room didnâ€™t had air conditioning ( ! ). Also, there is one only balcony surrounding all the building in every stage, which makes an easy access from a room to another if anyone would want to, so we didnâ€™t even risk sleeping with the window open. Itâ€™s a little strange why they donâ€™t just create individual balconies separating it for each room. That should be so easy to do! I understand that usually Amsterdam itâ€™s not a typical hot weather city, but even soâ€¦ it's a pity such a nice hotel to fail in this area. So it was a bit difficult to get a good night sleep, what was a real shame in a comfortable room and bed. The staff was great, always answering our questions about the city and giving us directions. The hotel is a little bit off the centre but the tram stops right in front of it, so it turns out to be easy to reach the main sites. The only problem with this location is that the last tram runs at about midnight ( hey Amsterdam ! get more night friendly ! ) so if you want to stay downtown a little longer you have to catch a taxi to get back to the hotel. We loved Amsterdam. Itâ€™s a very lovely city, especially the area along the Herengracht, Singel and Prisengracht canals. Go to Seven Bridges and enjoy the beautiful and romantic ambiance. Would recommend this hotel, but out of the hot days of summer, orâ€¦ check out in detail the weather report before you go!

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: jay12
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice place for the $. I have stayed in several areas of the city and this is not bad at all. The tram is pretty quick and the taxis at night get you back easily. Just make sure you have pocket change. If you have a car, the parking lot is pretty secure. the area is very quiet at night. I would definitely stay here again. The remodeled interior is also nice. Bathroom was tremendous.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but good service”
Reviews.Author: Platna
Reviews.Content: The location is one issure I have with this hotel. It is unwalkable from here to the center. You can take the 7 or 9 tram (9 from Grand Centraal) and it takes about 20-30 minutes. There is good and bad in this. It is located by Oosterpark, which is beautiful with a pond and ducks. We had a few very relaxing picnic lunches there. However, do not go to this park at night as the contingent changes drastically from regular people enjoying nature to young punks giving you dirty looks. The metro in Amsterdam is almost useless and you need to take the tram or bus (bus especially at night) to get anywhere if you are not centrally located. But in 2 days, we learned how to walk there and back and our last night we had no problems with taking a 2-hour walk around 3am back to the hotel from the center. The rooms are tiny and we had a double. The views of the park and city are cool, but seriously - the rooms are very cramped. The food is crazy overpriced - 13 euros for breakfast? I don't think so. But the service is excellent. The front desk is very courteous and attentive. By the way a cab to Schipol airport from here is 45 euros and takes around 20 minutes. We were almost late for our morning flight on the last night (fell asleep) but they checked us out very quickly and called the cab which was there in 5 minutes. We paid around $120 per night for this room. The only comparably-priced hotels near the center are dumps in or around the Red Light District which I wouldn't stay at ever. It sounds nice whehn you're booking but you are very dissapointed when you get there. We are all in our early 20's but none would stay there. This is a good compromise if you are fine with walking. Amsterdam is not hard to navigate: "just follow the canal."

Reviews.Title: “great breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: sammy dog67
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for three nights in december 2005. have been to Amsterdam twice before, this was the furthest out of the city centre we`d stayed. good, quiet location away from the bustle of the city centre. tram stop is right outside the hotel, and only 10 minutes ride into town, with a frequent service. modern, quiet hotel, rooms at the back of the hotel overlook the Oosterpark, and if you`re up high enough, you get a fantastic view. clean, contemporary decor, very helpful informative staff. breakfast was 10 euros when we went, but it`s buffet style, and something for everyone served in a bright airy restaurant. we really pigged out, and worked our way through all the dishes, even the apple tart. local shopping area close by with plenty of supermarkets. i would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and two others recently stayed at the NH Tropen. The room for 3 people was a bit small but rather nice. Warning: the floors are really nice but not carpeted, so waking up and taking a shower with a cold floor is not so pleasant. We had a corner room overlooking the park. The staff was inviting, warm, and friendly. Breakfast, though not included, was very nice. Fresh bread, croissants, fruit, cereals, juices, coffee, tea, water, milk, yogurt every morning, even well-stocked at the breakfast's ending time. Tram 9 will take you from Centraal Station to Mauritskade, the hotel's stop. Right next door is the Tropen Museum, which is interesting if you like anthropology. I would definitely stay at this hotel and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days in October 2004. I'm guessing that the hotel has been renovated/updated since the 2003 review was written. Linens, furniture and facilities seemed quite new and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Finally, although I haven't stayed in other places in Amsterdam (my first trip here), I think the hotel is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and good service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NH Tropen last weekend (Sep 18, 2004) and enjoyed it very much. Location is excellent. You can walk in 15 minuted to the Rembrandtsplein and the Artis Zoo is just around the corner. Rooms are nice and new (ask for the renovated rooms!) and on the top floors you have a nice view over Amsterdam. Staff is very friendly and breakfastbuffet is plenty (including apple-pie!) You can park at a small fee on the save parkinglot of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Tropen's peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: travelinwoman_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Tropen (the "Tulip Inn" is not included in the present name) on Linneausstraat in late May 2004. While the place is not fancy, it is very pleasant and quiet. We found it a good spot to recover from the jet lag of a long trip from Australia and equally good for accessing all parts of Amsterdam. The staff were friendly and helpful. Email was easy. The movie system doesn't work. The breakfast, at 13 euros per person, filled us up and let us have a snack lunch and a late dinner. Coffee, tea, interesting breads, sausage, bacon, eggs, cheeses, croissants, rolls, apple tart, and butter that actually tasted good. We didn't eat dinner there -- few choices and too smokey. The inn is very near the tram which will take you to downtown, to central station, and other points in the city very easily. Also, there is a pleasant park next to the hotel for walking or jogging, and many walk-able cafes, restaurants, and bakeries nearby, as well as ATMs, grocery stores, etc. There is a washer, dryer and iron available to guests. "Connexxion" bus service to/from the airport are much cheaper than a taxi and comes right to the hotel. Non-functioning movies and the occasionally smokey lobby and bar/restaurant were the only down sides to this hotel from our point of view. Central Amsterdam is very packed and busy -- if you want that, don't stay at the Tropen. If you want a bit of peace and quiet with easy access to downtown by a 10-minute tram ride (or 20 minute walk), the Tropen is great.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Tulip Inn Tropen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Tupip in is not centrally located but that can be a good thing. Plenty of "whole in the wall" places nearby. There is a tram practically outside the front door not to mention the taxi stand just as close. The staff is great. I recommend the top floor for the views.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Tropen
HotelInfo.Address: Linnaeusstraat 2C, Amsterdam 1092 CK, The Netherlands
